data.name: GcdsParagraph1
data.value: All GC Design System components are compatible out of the box. Just make sure the library is configured to point to the latest version. If the version was recently updated, you may not yet see autocomplete suggestions in Foundation.

data.name: GcdsLinkText
data.value: Find all components in the <gcds-link href="https://design-system.alpha.canada.ca/en/components/" target="_blank" external> GC Design System documentation </gcds-link>.

data.name: GcdsParagraph2
data.value: To use GC Design System components, you‚Äôll need to use the Web Component code. The components should also appear in Visual Studio if they have been implemented. However, even if a component doesn't appear in IntelliSense, you can still use it‚Äîjust make sure you‚Äôre referencing the correct version of the GC Design System.

data.name: Badges_Overview_Text
data.value: The <fdcp-badge> component is used to highlight small pieces of information...

data.name: Badges_Solid_Text
data.value: These badges use a solid background.

data.name: Badges_Inverted_Text
data.value: Use the inverted="true" attribute to render badges with transparent backgrounds.

data.name: Badges_Slot_Text
data.value: You can insert an icon or button at the start or end using either the slot attribute or the StartContent/EndContent properties.

data.name: Badges_Parameters_Style
data.value: Badge style (Primary, Success, Danger, Info, etc.)

data.name: Badges_Parameters_StartContent
data.value: Optional HTML to prepend before the badge content.

data.name: Badges_Parameters_EndContent
data.value: Optional HTML to append after the badge content.

data.name: Badges_Parameters_TagId
data.value: Optional id attribute for the badge element.

data.name: Badges_Notes_2
data.value: For font icons, use libraries like Font Awesome or Bootstrap Icons.

data.name: Badges_Notes_3
data.value: All badges are rendered as <span> elements with class fdcp-badge.

data.name: GlobalResources_Description
data.value: This page demonstrates how to use the new global resources configuration feature in GCFoundation. You can configure CSS, JavaScript, meta tags, and link tags globally through the appsettings.json file.

data.name: GlobalResources_CurrentConfiguration_Description
data.value: The following resources are currently configured to be loaded globally:

data.name: GlobalResources_ResourceInclusion_Description
data.value: The following settings control which optional resources are included:

data.name: GlobalResources_DefaultFilesNote
data.value: Note: Default foundation CSS and JavaScript files are always included and cannot be disabled. This ensures that all GCFoundation components work properly on every page.

data.name: GlobalResources_LoadingOrder_Description
data.value: Resources are loaded in the following order:

data.name: GlobalResources_HowToConfigure_Description
data.value: To configure global resources, update your appsettings.json file:

data.name: GlobalResources_UsingHelper_Description
data.value: You can also use the GlobalResourceHelper in your Razor views for more control:

data.name: UserLogin_Authenticated_Message
data.value: You are currently logged in as {0}

data.name: UserLogin_NotAuthenticated_Message
data.value: You are not currently logged in. Use the simulate login button below to test the authenticated state.

data.name: UserLogin_ApiTest_Message
data.value: See how to integrate with APIs to get user information.

data.name: UserLogin_PageDescription
data.value: This page demonstrates the configurable User Login partial component with English and French localization support. The partial can be customized through configuration settings and displays different information based on authentication status.

data.name: UserLogin_TestAuthStates
data.value: Test the login partial with different authentication states.

data.name: UserLogin_ConfigDescription
data.value: The User Login partial supports the following configuration options through appsettings.json:

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_Bilingual
data.value: Fully bilingual (English/French) with automatic language detection

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_Configurable
data.value: Configurable display options (show/hide various user information)

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_Avatar
data.value: User avatar support with automatic initials generation

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_GCDS
data.value: GCDS component integration for consistent Government of Canada styling

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_Responsive
data.value: Responsive design for mobile and desktop

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_Accessibility
data.value: Accessibility features with proper ARIA labels

data.name: UserLogin_Feature_Integration
data.value: Easy integration with existing authentication systems

data.name: UserLogin_Position_Description
data.value: This example shows how the User Login partial can be positioned in different areas of your application.

data.name: UserLogin_Position_Header_Alert
data.value: The login partial is displayed in the header area (above this content).

data.name: UserLogin_Position_Sidebar_Content
data.value: This is the main content area. The login partial is displayed in the sidebar to the left (on desktop) or above (on mobile).

data.name: UserLogin_Position_Content_Before
data.value: This is content before the login partial.

data.name: UserLogin_Position_Content_After
data.value: This is content after the login partial.

data.name: UserLogin_Position_Footer_Content
data.value: The main content area. The login partial will be displayed in the footer area (below this content).

data.name: UserLogin_Component_Description
data.value: A configurable, bilingual user login information component that displays authentication status, user details, and session information. Perfect for Azure cloud deployments with stateless authentication.

data.name: UserLogin_LiveExamples_Description
data.value: Below are working examples of the User Login Partial in different configurations:

data.name: UserLogin_CurrentUserState_Description
data.value: This shows the actual authentication state from the current user context.

data.name: UserLogin_SimulateLoginNote
data.value: Use the "Simulate Login" button in the Examples section to see the authenticated state.

data.name: UserLogin_DefaultMode_Description
data.value: Standard full display mode with user information.

data.name: UserLogin_NotAuthenticatedState_Description
data.value: Display for users who are not logged in.

data.name: UserLogin_ConfigOptions_Description
data.value: The User Login Partial is highly configurable through appsettings.json and supports both stateless and session-based authentication systems.

data.name: UserLogin_BilingualSupport_Description
data.value: Automatic English/French localization with resource files and culture detection.

data.name: UserLogin_CloudReady_Description
data.value: Stateless authentication support perfect for Azure App Service and container deployments.

data.name: UserLogin_Configurable_Description
data.value: 15+ configuration options to customize display and behavior for your needs.

data.name: UserLogin_Responsive_Description
data.value: Mobile-first design that works perfectly on all device sizes.

data.name: UserLogin_GCDSStyled_Description
data.value: Uses Government of Canada Design System components for consistent styling.

data.name: UserLogin_Accessible_Description
data.value: WCAG compliant with proper ARIA labels and semantic markup.

data.name: UserLogin_SupportedAuthMethods_Description
data.value: The component automatically extracts user information from claims, making it compatible with various authentication systems:

data.name: UserLogin_CookieAuth_Description
data.value: Stateless cookie-based auth without server-side sessions. Perfect for Azure cloud deployments.

data.name: UserLogin_AzureAD_Description
data.value: Enterprise authentication with Office 365 integration and single sign-on support.

data.name: UserLogin_JWTTokens_Description
data.value: JSON Web Token authentication for API-first applications and microservices.

data.name: UserLogin_ExternalProviders_Description
data.value: OAuth integration with Google, GitHub, Microsoft, and other external providers.

data.name: UserLogin_CompleteExamples_Description
data.value: Interactive examples with different configurations and use cases.

data.name: UserLogin_StatelessAuth_Description
data.value: Azure cloud-ready authentication examples without sessions.

data.name: UserLogin_TemplateIntegration_Description
data.value: Learn how to integrate the partial into your layout templates.

data.name: Cards_Overview_Text
data.value: The <fdcp-card> component provides a flexible and extensible content container inspired by Bootstrap cards, designed with Government of Canada Design System (GCDS) styling. It includes options for headers, footers, images, and various contextual background colors.

data.name: Cards_Basic_Text
data.value: A basic card with mixed content and flexible width.

data.name: Cards_WithSlots_Text
data.value: Use the slot attribute to define header, body, and footer sections.

data.name: Cards_WithImages_Text
data.value: Cards support top and bottom images using the image-top and image-bottom attributes.

data.name: Cards_Horizontal_Text
data.value: Use the horizontal="true" attribute to create horizontal card layouts.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_TagId
data.value: Optional id attribute for the card element.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_Width
data.value: Sets the width of the card using CSS value (e.g., "18rem", "300px", "100%").

data.name: Cards_Parameters_Height
data.value: Sets the height of the card using CSS value (e.g., "200px", "auto", "100%").

data.name: Cards_Parameters_Border
data.value: Whether the card should have a border. Default is true.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_Shadow
data.value: Whether the card should have a shadow. Default is false.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_ImageTop
data.value: URL for the card image that appears at the top.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_ImageBottom
data.value: URL for the card image that appears at the bottom.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_ImageAlt
data.value: Alt text for the card images.

data.name: Cards_Parameters_Horizontal
data.value: Whether the card should use horizontal layout. Default is false.

data.name: Cards_Notes_1
data.value: Use slot="header", slot="body", and slot="footer" to define card sections.

data.name: Cards_Notes_2
data.value: Cards are responsive and will adapt to their container width unless a specific width is set.

data.name: Cards_Notes_3
data.value: All cards use GCDS color variables for consistent Government of Canada styling.

data.name: StatelessAuth_Demo_Description
data.value: Try the cookie authentication below and see how the User Login Partial updates automatically.

data.name: StatelessAuth_Authenticated_Description
data.value: The User Login Partial above shows your current session information from claims (no server-side session storage).

data.name: StatelessAuth_NotAuthenticated_Description
data.value: Notice how the User Login Partial will update automatically after login.

data.name: StatelessAuth_CookieDemo_Description
data.value: Test cookie-based authentication without server sessions. All user data comes from claims in the authentication cookie.

data.name: StatelessAuth_LoggedIn_Text
data.value: You're logged in! Click logout to clear the authentication cookie.

data.name: StatelessAuth_LoggedOut_Text
data.value: This will create an authentication cookie with user claims (no session storage).

data.name: StatelessAuth_Methods_Description
data.value: The GC Foundation supports multiple stateless authentication approaches for Azure cloud deployment:

data.name: StatelessAuth_CookieAuth_Description
data.value: Uses authentication cookies with claims (no server sessions). ‚úÖ Recommended for most web apps.

data.name: StatelessAuth_AzureAD_Description
data.value: Enterprise authentication with Microsoft identity platform. Perfect for government applications.

data.name: StatelessAuth_JWT_Description
data.value: Stateless API authentication using JSON Web Tokens. Ideal for microservices and APIs.

data.name: StatelessAuth_OAuth_Description
data.value: External authentication providers (Google, GitHub, etc.). Good for public-facing applications.

data.name: Index_Table_Description
data.value: A way to display information in a table

data.name: Index_Modal_Description
data.value: A way to display information in a popup box (modal)

data.name: Index_FilteredSearch_Description
data.value: A way to display search with filtered result

data.name: Index_Card_Description
data.value: Flexible content containers with headers, footers, and images

data.name: Index_PageHeading_Description
data.value: A way to add main heading at the top of the page

data.name: Index_FormBuilder_Description
data.value: A way to build form automatically from a structure

data.name: Index_Stepper_Description
data.value: Create a stepper for a flow or a form

data.name: Index_UserLoginPartial_Description
data.value: Configurable user login information display with bilingual support
